content:
@Yakov Pechersky Yes, that seems to work. As Eric suggested, I dropped the names from the typeclass arguments. But what got it to work more or less consistently was to add the @[reducible] annotation by the definitions of bounded_stacks etc.

Also, to answer the original question I had, apparently you can get the inferred instance explicitly using infer_instance, though I don't usually need it anymore since Lean infers the typeclasses correctly.
Praneeth Kolichala has marked this topic as resolved.
